description: From Hindi कमरबन्द (kamarband) and Urdu کمر بند‎ (kamar band, “belt, waistband”), from Persian کمربند‎ (kamarband), from کمر‎ (kamar, “waist”) + بند‎ (band, “band”).

entries.meaning: (fashion) A broad sash, especially one that is pleated lengthwise and worn as an article of formal dress, as around a man's waist together with a tuxedo or dinner jacket. [from early 17th c.]
